model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Parent, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Co-workers A: Crazy how time flies. Like when we found out Ms. Singh was leaving our school. I still can't believe that was two years ago.

[MEMORY]
1. Co-worker B was surprised when Co-worker A found out they were married.
2. Co-worker A and Co-worker B shared happy memories from their time working together.
3. Co-worker A is observant and did some research on social media to find out that Co-worker B is married.
4. Co-worker A has a talent for solving puzzles and mysteries.
5. Co-worker B is married and had a weekend where they went hiking and had dinner with friends.
6. Co-worker A and Co-worker B used to work together at a clothing store.
current_dialogue: Co-workers A: Crazy how time flies. Like when we found out Ms. Singh was leaving our school. I still can't believe that was two years ago.

speaker: Parent
raw_prediction: Time really does fly, doesn't it? It feels like just yesterday we were all working together at the clothing store. Those were some fun times.
